Home > misc > dist > stk_filldist_exact.m

stk_filldist_exact

PURPOSE

STK_FILLDIST_EXACT computes the (exact) fill distance of a set of points.

SYNOPSIS

function [fd, ymax] = stk_filldist_exact(x, box) %---------------------------------------

DESCRIPTION 

 STK_FILLDIST_EXACT computes the (exact) fill distance of a set of points.

 CALL: FD = stk_filldist_exact(X, BOX)

    computes the fill distance FD of the dataset X in the hyper-rectangle
    BOX, using the computational-geometric algorithm of L. Pronzato and 
    W. G. Muller [1]. Recall that

       D = max_{Y in BOX} min_{1 <= i <= n} norm(X(i,:) - Y),         (1)

    where norm(.) denotes the Euclidean norm in R^d. Optimal designs with
    respect to the fill distance are sometimes called "minimax" designs
    (see, e.g., [2]).

 CALL: FD = stk_filldist_exact(X)

    assumes that the fill distance is to be computed with respect to the
    hyperrectangle BOX = [0; 1]^d.

 CALL: [FD, YMAX] = stk_filldist_exact(...)

    also returns the point YMAX where the maximal distance is attained,
    i.e., the argmax in equation (1).

 REFERENCES:

   [1] Luc Pronzato and Werner G. Müller, "Design of computer 
       experiments: space filling and beyond", Statistics and Computing,
       22(3):681-701, 2012.

   [2] Mark E. Johnson, Leslie M. Moore and Donald Ylvisaker, "Minimax
       and maximin distance designs", Journal of Statistical Planning
       and Inference, 26(2):131-148, 1990.

 See also: stk_filldist, stk_filldist_discretized, stk_dist, stk_mindist

CROSS-REFERENCE INFORMATION

This function calls:
This function is called by:
  • stk_filldist STK_FILLDIST computes the fill distance of a set of points.

SUBFUNCTIONS

  • function y = add_symm(x, box)

0072 function [fd, ymax] = stk_filldist_exact(x, box) %---------------------------------------
0073 
0074 if nargin > 2,
0075    stk_error ('Too many input arguments.', 'TooManyInputArgs');
0076 end
0077 x = double(x);
0078 [n, d] = size(x);
0079 
0080 if nargin == 1,
0081     box = repmat([0; 1], 1, d);
0082 else
0083     box = double(box);
0084 end    
0085 
0086 %--- Construct a triangulation that covers [0; 1]^d -------------------------------------
0087 
0088 x  = add_symm(x, box); % extend using symmetries with respect to the faces
0089 
0090 % 2013/03/13: at the present time, Octave doesn't have the 'stable' option
0091 % (but, fortunately, we don't really care about doing a STABLE sort here...)
0092 
0093 % remove duplicates to avoid a a warning in delaunayn()
0094 x = unique(x, 'rows');
0095 
0096 dt = delaunayn(x);     % Delaunay trianulation
0097 nt = length(dt(:, 1)); % number of triangles
0098 
0099 %--- Compute centers and radiuses -------------------------------------------------------
0100 
0101 center   = zeros(nt, d);  % prepare for computing the centers
0102 rsquared = zeros(nt, 1);  % prepare for computing the (squared) radiuses
0103 
0104 for i = 1:nt,
0105     Z = x(dt(i, :), :);  % vertices of the simplex
0106     W = sum(Z.^2, 2);    % squared norms
0107     C = repmat(Z(1, :), d, 1) - Z(2:end, :);
0108     B = (W(1) - W(2:end))/2;
0109     center(i, :) = transpose(C\B);
0110     rsquared(i, 1) = sum(center(i,:).^2) + W(1) - 2 * Z(1, :) * center(i, :)';
0111 end
0112 
0113 %--- Find the simplices for which the center is (almost) inside the box -----------------
0114 
0115 % enlarge box for numerical tolerance
0116 TOLERANCE = 1e-10;
0117 bbox = box + TOLERANCE * [-1; 1] * diff(box);
0118 
0119 inside = true(size(center, 1), 1);
0120 for j = 1:d,
0121     inside = inside & (center(:, j) >= bbox(1, j)) ...
0122                     & (center(:, j) <= bbox(2, j)) ;
0123 end
0124 
0125 %--- Grand finale -----------------------------------------------------------------------
0126 
0127 % maximal radius for centers that are almost inside the box
0128 [rsquared_max, idx_max] = max(rsquared .* double(inside));
0129 
0130 % project on the box
0131 ymax = max(min(center(idx_max, :), box(2, :)),  box(1, :));
0132 
0133 % fill distance
0134 fd = sqrt(rsquared_max);
0135 
0136 % safety net
0137 if isinf(fd) || any(isnan(ymax)),
0138     errmsg = 'This is surprising... How did I get here ???';
0139     stk_error(errmsg, 'AlgorithmFailure');
0140 end
0141 
0142 end % function stk_filldist_exact -------------------------------------------------------
0143 
0144 
0145 %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
0146 %   add_sym   %
0147 %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
0148 
0149 function y = add_symm(x, box) %----------------------------------------------------------
0150 
0151 [n d] = size(x);
0152 k = 2 * d + 1;
0153 y = repmat(x, k, 1);
0154 
0155 for j = 1:d
0156     y(n*j+1:(j+1)*n, j) = 2 * box(1, j) - x(1:n, j);
0157     y((k-j)*n+1:(k+1-j)*n, j) = 2 * box(2, j) - x(1:n, j);
0158 end
0159 
0160 end % function add_symm -----------------------------------------------------------------
0161 
0162

0164 % Check that both double-precision matrices and stk_dataframe objects are accepted
0165 
0166 
0167 
0168 
0169 
0170 
0171 
0172 %%
0173 % One point in the middle of [0; 1]^d
0174 
0175 
0176 
0177 
0178 
0179 
0180 
0181 
0182 %%
0183 % One point in the middle of [1; 2]^d
0184 
0185 
0186 
0187 
0188 
0189 
0190 
0191 
0192 
0193 %%
0194 % One point at the origin, BOX = [0; 1]^d
